title: Spectrum correction on Ekman-Navier-Stokes equation in two-dimensions
authors:
V.J. Valad\~ao, G. Boffetta, M. Crialesi-Esposito, F. De Lillo, S.
  Musacchio
abstract:
It has been long known that the addition of linear friction on
two-dimensional Navier-Stokes (NS) turbulence, often referred to as
Ekman-Navier-Stokes (ENS) turbulence, induces strong intermittent fluctuations
on small-scale vorticity. Such fluctuations are strong enough to be measurable
at low-order statistics such as the energy or enstrophy spectrum. Simple
heuristics lead to corrections in the spectrum which are proportional to the
linear friction coefficient. In this work, we study the spectral correction by
the implementation of a GPU-accelerated high-resolution numerical simulation of
ENS covering a large range of Reynolds numbers. Among our findings, we
highlight the importance of non-locality when comparing the expected results to
the measured ones.
